question: Indian Railways has commissioned the country's first governmental waste-to-energy plant in which city?
explanation:
The country’s first governmental waste to energy plant is commissioned by the Indian Railways in Bhubaneswar under the East Coast Railway zone.
The plant has a waste-handling capacity of 500 kilogram per day and it has been constructed in just three months at an installation cost of Rs 1.79 crore. The plant uses a patented technology called ‘Polycrack’, which converts multiple feed-stocks into hydrocarbon liquid fuels, gas, carbon and water. The plant is commissioned at Mancheswar Carriage Repair workshop, from where the waste is collected and fed to the plant.
